    • Method Detail

      • log

        public static void log(String logText)
        Manages action counter and calls writeLog to format and print the log entry.
        Parameters:
        logText - the text that needs to be logged in this action

      • log

        public static void log(Exception e)
        Format an exception message and stack trace, and calls attach to add it as a log entry.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception that will be logged in this action

      • attach

        @Step(value="Attachement: {attachmentType} - {attachmentName}")
public static void attach(String attachmentType,
                                                                                          String attachmentName,
                                                                                          InputStream attachmentContent)
        Adds a new attachment using the input parameters provided. The attachment is displayed as a step in the execution report. Used for Screenshots.
        Parameters:
        attachmentType - the type of this attachment
        attachmentName - the name of this attachment
        attachmentContent - the content of this attachment

      • attach

        @Step(value="Attachment: {attachmentName}")
public static void attach(String attachmentName,
                                                                      String attachmentContent)
        Adds a new attachment using the input parameters provided. The attachment is displayed as a step in the execution report. Used for REST API Responses.
        Parameters:
        attachmentName - the name of this attachment
        attachmentContent - the content of this attachment

      • getTestLog

        @Attachment(value="Test log")
public static String getTestLog()
        Returns the log of the current test, and attaches it in the end of the test execution report.
        Returns:
        the log for the current test

      • getFullLog

        public static void getFullLog()
        Returns the complete log of the current execution session, and attaches it in the end of the test execution report.
